document.heading: Commercial Mobile Telecommunication Service Tax Clarification Amendment Act of 1998

history.narrative: Law 12-100, the “Commercial Mobile Telecommunication Service Tax Clarification Amendment Act of 1998,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-425, which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 4, 1997, and January 6, 1998, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 27, 1998, it was assigned Act No. 12-276 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-100 became effective on April 30, 1998.
